item.title: There was no category for this so I had to select a different one to continue, 19th November
item.description:
1. Abandoned traffic cones, probably left over from the S-T work on New Road. This is on New Road between Pottersfield and Gambles. 2. The other pic is of an abandoned diversion sign. It's on the green at the junction of New Road and Stockwell Lane

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): New Road, Woodmancote, Tewkesbury

item.title: Environmental pollution from shops, 19th November
item.description:
Every time it is windy, the plastic waste and cardboard blows out of the bins at the back of Iceland. It then blows down the tunnel and onto the square and collect in front of the British Heart Foundation. It is time to put a stop to this Iceland have been told on several occasions And have failed to make adjustments to the waste process

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Edinburgh Place, St Mark's, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road Obstruction by Parking Cars, 18th November
item.description:
The road is within the Stoke Orchard Estate. There are parking cars Obstructing the road where there should be no parking cars causing safety concerns as if emergency vehicles would need to be called would not be able to access the properties. Not to mention that where the cars are parking are within 10 meters of a double junction causing other road users to go into the opposite side increasing the risk for accidents and blocking the view for other drivers. Also, blocking the houses driveway again increasing the risk for collision! There should be double yellow line on the part of the road, as well as the free parking spaces should be clearly lined out so these risks could be mitigated!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 25, Greenwood Drive, Stoke Orchard, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gloucester Street, Winchcombe, Winchcombe

item.title: Highways safety barriers continually collapsing and creating a hazard, 18th November
item.description:
Outside numbers 21 and 23 Beverley Gardens, the pavement was closed by GCC Highways as it was considered unsafe for pedestrians. But the barriers (each secured by just one sandbag) fall onto path and road daily creating an obstruction and hazard. Residents have tried to make them more secure but without success. The street is unlit at night.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Beverley Gardens, Woodmancote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
